dock.definition::
[n.] 码头；船坞；船埠；港区
[v.] 停靠码头；（使航天器在外层空间）对接；扣除（部分工资等）
[网络] 底座；基座；被告席
dock.example::
[1] And yet, when I dropped my wife and her many layers of clothing off at the dock, only eight boats sit out on the bay.
[2] Unlike in a normal crown court case, they did not have to sit behind the glass of the dock. Instead they sat behind their barristers.
[3] You recall that you arrived at the beach on a boat and that you left the boat tied to the dock. You know how you will get home.

nowadays.definition::
[adv.] 现在；现今；目前
[n.] 现在
[网络] 当今；如今；时下
nowadays.example::
[1] Once upon a time this was called the American Dream. Nowadays it might be called America's Fitful Reverie.
[2] Nowadays the children are growing up sweetly as if they were soaked in a honey jar.
[3] Well, there is also a possibility of using function names for recursion, but you will soon see that this is often impractical nowadays.

recovery.definition::
[n.] 恢复；复苏；回升；痊愈
[网络] 复原；回收；康复
recovery.example::
[1] Totti is expected to be out of action for up to three months, but he insists he's desperate to get started on his recovery.
[2] He made a quick recovery from his illness and was soon back at work.
[3] Bernanke said the Fed is "prepared to take further policy actions as needed" to keep the recovery on track.

dust.definition::
[n.] 粉尘；尘埃；尘土；粉末
[v.] 擦去…的灰尘；擦灰；掸去；刷去
[网络] 掸掉灰尘；粉剂
dust.example::
[1] Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
[2] the only car visible was the dust-covered wreck of a Ford which crouched in a dim corner.
[3] Hate him she did not quite; but he was dust and ashes to her, and even for her name's sake she scarcely wished to marry him.

linen.definition::
[n.] 亚麻布；亚麻织品
[adj.] 亚麻的；亚麻色的
[网络] 亚麻制品；亚麻织物；亚麻布制品
linen.example::
[1] So Joseph bought some linen cloth, took down the body, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock.
[2] And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
[3] the linen lap robe carefully about her to keep off the dust.
